attributes.action: Make it law that all hospital parking charges are to go to the NHS not APCOA
attributes.additional_details: Having spent alot of time in hospital recently it has been made apparent that the upwards of £10 to £20 a day parking charges are going to private company's. Why?  https://www.apcoa.co.uk/ own and run the majority of car parks in the UK for the NHS and are only giving them a fraction of the profit, I would like to see the NHS benefit from all the profits of the car parking we pay to visit for appointments etc.
attributes.background: Private company's are monopolising car parking for hospitals receiving thousands of pounds a day that could be given to the NHS. APCOA and other companies should be made to give all profits from Hospital parking to the NHS by law.

rejection.details: We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The decision on the use of car parking providers is a matter for individual NHS trusts.
